pageContext.claim: “Again, [the conflict between Turks and Kurds] has been thousands of years in the process, between borders, between these countries and other countries that we're involved with, 7,000 miles away.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump frequently and misleadingly says there has been a conflict lasting "hundreds of years" or "centuries" between the Turks and the Kurds, apparently as explanation for why a U.S. role in the region would be fruitless. This is not only simplistic but historically ignorant and false. There has been a hundred-year effort to create a Kurdish state in the aftermath of the collapse of the Ottoman Empire, with the Kurds frequently manipulated by great powers seeking to flex their muscles against a particular nation. The  Kurdish people are not natural enemies of the Turks and their history has periods of peace and suppression between violence.
